name: Dropdown
description: The Dropdown component is a custom-made data selection component.

props.name: title
props.doc: give a title to let the users know what they have to do. Defaults to `Valgmeny`.

props.name: value
props.doc: define a preselected data entry (index). More info down below.

props.name: variant
props.doc: defines the kind of dropdown. Possible values are `primary`, `secondary`, `tertiary` and `signal`. Defaults to `secondary`.

props.name: icon
props.doc: icon to be included in the dropdown.

props.name: icon_size
props.doc: change the size of the icon pragmatically.

props.name: icon_position
props.doc: position of the icon inside the dropdown. Set to `left` or `right`. Defaults to `right`.

props.name: triangle_position
props.doc: position of arrow / triangle of the drawer. Set to `left` or `right`. Defaults to `right`.

props.name: size
props.doc: define the height of the Dropdown. Can be set to `small`, `default`, `medium` and `large`. Defaults to `default`.

props.name: opened
props.doc: if set to `true`, the Dropdown will be rendered initially with a visible and accessible data list / options.

props.name: open_on_focus
props.doc: if set to `true`, the Dropdown will be opened when the users enter the trigger button with a focus action.

props.name: prevent_selection
props.doc: if set to `true`, no permanent selection will be made. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: action_menu
props.doc: same as `prevent_selection`, but the DrawerList will be opened from the bottom of the page for mobile devices. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: more_menu
props.doc: same as `prevent_selection`, but the "selection area" (given title) will not be visible and the icon `more` (three dots) is used. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: align_dropdown
props.doc: use `right` to change the options alignment direction. Makes only sense to use in combination with `prevent_selection` or `more_menu`. Defaults to `left`.

props.name: independent_width
props.doc: If set to `true`, the Dropdown will handle its width independent to the content width. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: skip_portal
props.doc: set to `true` to disable the React Portal behavior. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: stretch
props.doc: if set to `true`, then the dropdown will be 100% in available `width`.

props.name: status
props.doc: text with a status message. The style defaults to an error message. You can use `true` to only get the status color, without a message.

props.name: status_state
props.doc: defines the state of the status. It's two statuses `[error, info]`. Defaults to `error`.

props.name: status_props
props.doc: use an object to define additional FormStatus properties.

props.name: globalStatus
props.doc: the [configuration](/uilib/components/global-status/properties/#configuration-object) used for the target [GlobalStatus](/uilib/components/global-status).

props.name: label
props.doc: prepends the Form Label component. If no ID is provided, a random ID is created.

props.name: label_direction
props.doc: use `label_direction="vertical"` to change the label layout direction. Defaults to `horizontal`.

props.name: label_sr_only
props.doc: use `true` to make the label only readable by screen readers.

props.name: suffix
props.doc: text describing the content of the Dropdown more than the label. You can also send in a React component, so it gets wrapped inside the Dropdown component.

props.name: trigger_element
props.doc: lets you provide a custom React element as the trigger HTML element.

props.name: innerRef
props.doc: by providing a React.ref you can get the internally used main element (DOM). E.g. `innerRef={myRef}` by using `React.createRef()` or `React.useRef()`.

props.name: buttonRef
props.doc: by providing a React.ref you can get the internally used button element (DOM). E.g. `buttonRef={myRef}` by using `React.createRef()` or `React.useRef()`.

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.

events.name: on_change
events.doc: will be called on state changes made by the user. Returns an object with the new selected `data` item `{ data, event, attributes, value }`.

events.name: on_select
events.doc: will be called once the user focuses or selects an item by a click or keyboard navigation. Returns an object with the new selected `data` item `{ data, event, attributes, value, active_item }`. The **active_item** property is the currently selected item by keyboard navigation.

events.name: on_show
events.doc: will be called once the user presses the dropdown. Returns the data item `{ data, attributes }`.

events.name: on_hide
events.doc: will be called once the user presses the dropdown again, or clicks somewhere else. Returns the data item `{ data, attributes }`.
